ai-sn31:1.1.1_0: At one time the Buddha was staying near Sāvatthī in Jeta’s Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s monastery. ...
ai-sn31:1.1.3_0: “Mendicants, I will teach you about the gods of fairykind.
ai-sn31:1.1.5_0: And what are the gods of fairykind?
ai-sn31:1.1.16_0: These are called the gods of fairykind.”
ai-sn31:2.1.3_0: “Sir, what is the cause, what is the reason why someone, when their body breaks up, after death, is reborn in the company of the gods of fairykind?”
ai-sn31:2.1.4_0: “Mendicant, it’s when someone does good things by way of body, speech, and mind.
ai-sn31:2.1.6_0: ‘The gods of fairykind are long-lived, beautiful, and very happy.’
ai-sn31:2.1.8_0: ‘If only, when my body breaks up, after death, I would be reborn in the company of the gods of fairykind!’
ai-sn31:2.1.9_0: When their body breaks up, after death, they’re reborn in the company of the gods of fairykind.
ai-sn31:2.1.10_0: This is the cause, this is the reason why someone, when their body breaks up, after death, is reborn in the company of the gods of fairykind.”
ai-sn31:3.1.3_0: “Sir, what is the cause, what is the reason why someone, when their body breaks up, after death, is reborn in the company of the gods of fairykind who live in fragrant roots?”
ai-sn31:3.1.4_0: “Mendicant, it’s when someone does good things by way of body, speech, and mind.
ai-sn31:3.1.6_0: ‘The gods of fairykind who live in fragrant roots are long-lived, beautiful, and very happy.’
ai-sn31:3.1.8_0: ‘If only, when my body breaks up, after death, I would be reborn in the company of the gods of fairykind who live in fragrant roots!’
ai-sn31:3.1.9_0: They give gifts of fragrant roots.
ai-sn31:3.1.10_0: When their body breaks up, after death, they’re reborn in the company of the gods of fairykind who live in fragrant roots.
ai-sn31:3.1.11_0: This is the cause, this is the reason.”

ai-sn31:4-12.1.31_0: They give gifts of fragrant fruit,
ai-sn31:4-12.1.34_0: When their body breaks up, after death, they’re reborn in the company of the gods of fairykind who live in fragrant scents.
ai-sn31:4-12.1.35_0: This is the cause, this is the reason why someone, when their body breaks up, after death, is reborn in the company of the gods of fairykind who live on fragrant scents.”
